revised_title: Antibiotic Resistance Patterns in Soil Bacteria from Young and Old Habitats on the Krakatau Islands
tldr: This study examines the antibiotic resistance patterns and relative concentrations of soil bacteria (gram-negative rods) in various age ash deposits on the Krakatau Islands. The research found that very young land habitats had significantly lower concentrations of antibiotic-resistant bacteria compared to older habitats, with vegetation playing a crucial role in the development of antibiotic resistance in soil microorganisms.
